title: Congress Releases Third List of 16 Candidates For Delhi Assembly Elections | LIVE - Republic World
summary:
Congress Releases Third List of 16 Candidates For Delhi Assembly Elections

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: ANI

The Congress party has announced its third list of candidates for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections, highlighting key election strategies and selections.

  • The third list includes 16 candidates.
  • This comes ahead of the February 2025 Delhi Assembly elections.
  • Key dates for the Maha Kumbh festival are also discussed, marking significant religious observances.
“The exam has been postponed... in the interest of the aspirants,” Rajesh Kumar, Director (Exams), NTA.

This election cycle represents a critical juncture for the Congress party in Delhi as they prepare to face the challenges presented during this electoral period.
newTitle: Congress Releases Third List of 16 Candidates For Delhi Assembly Elections

title: AAP faces FIR for posting AI-generated videos of Modi, Shah on X - Moneycontrol
summary:
AAP faces FIR for AI-Generated Videos of Modi and Shah

Date: January 14, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Delhi Police has registered an FIR against the Aam Aadmi Party ​(AAP) for allegedly posting AI-generated photos and videos of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah on the party's official X handle.

  • The case was lodged at the North Avenue police station.
  • The FIR was based on a complaint regarding objectionable content.
  • The videos were posted by AAP on January 10 and 13.
The alleged videos have sparked controversy around content posting on social media.

This incident raises questions about the use of AI-generated content in political discourse and its implications for responsible communication.
newTitle: AAP faces FIR for AI-Generated Videos of Modi and Shah

title: Haryana BJP chief among 2 booked for alleged gangrape in Himachal's Kasauli - Hindustan Times
Bus fire in Vrindavan claims life of Maha Kumbh pilgrim - The Times of India
summary:
Bus Fire in Vrindavan Claims Life of Maha Kumbh Pilgrim

Date: Tuesday evening | Source: Times of India

A tragedy struck when an elderly pilgrim lost his life in a bus fire while traveling to the Maha Kumbh in Prayagraj.

  • The bus was carrying around 50 pilgrims from Telangana.
  • The fire started while the bus was parked at a tourist center in Vrindavan.
  • Witnesses reported sparks coming from the vehicle before it engulfed in flames.
  • Emergency services were unable to reach in time to save the trapped passenger.
  • The deceased was identified as Dhrupati, who chose to stay inside the bus.
“Dhrupati was smoking a beedi and opted to remain inside while others stepped out,” said a fellow passenger.

The incident is currently under investigation to determine the cause of the fire.
newTitle: Bus Fire in Vrindavan Claims Life of Maha Kumbh Pilgrim

title: Schools In Prayagraj To Remain Closed Tomorrow For Grades 1 To 8, Classes To Be Held Online - News18
Vision Document 2047: IMD aims for zero-error forecast up to 3 days - Business Standard
summary:
Vision Document 2047: IMD aims for zero-error forecast up to 3 days

Publication Date: Recent news

Source: Business Standard

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has set ambitious goals for its weather forecasting abilities, aiming for zero-error forecasts for up to three days and 90% accuracy for five days by 2047.

  • IMD celebrates its 150th anniversary with new targets for weather forecasting.
  • Aims for zero loss of life during severe weather by enhancing early warning systems.
  • Targets include 80% accuracy for seven-day forecasts and 70% for ten-day forecasts by 2047.
  • Plans to improve meteorological observational systems at the village level through advanced technology.
  • The Vision Document emphasizes the importance of modern meteorology in disaster management.
"Meteorology offers the most important support for disaster management capability of any country. To minimise the impact of natural disasters, we need to maximise the efficiency of meteorology," - Narendra Modi.

In conclusion, the IMD's Vision Document outlines a strategic shift towards enhancing weather forecast accuracy and disaster management efficiency, significantly impacting public safety and economic resilience in the years ahead.
newTitle: IMD Aims for Zero-Error Weather Forecasts by 2047

title: 'Apologise To Indians': Parliamentary Panel To Summon Meta Over Zuckerberg's Poll Loss Remark - News18
Heavy-duty military drone of Israeli-origin crashes into the sea off Porbandar - The Times of India
summary:
Israeli-Origin Military Drone Crashes into Sea Off Porbandar

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

A heavy-duty drone, the Drishti-10, crashed into the sea during its pre-acceptance trials off Porbandar in Gujarat. Assembled in India under a license from Israel, the drone was being operated when it ditched into the water.

  • The Drishti-10 drone is based on the Hermes 900 Starliner from Israeli firm Elbit Systems.
  • It is designed for long-range ISR missions and can operate at altitudes of up to 30,000 feet with an endurance of 36 hours.
  • The vendor has retrieved the drone for analysis, and the incident has no financial implications for the Navy, as the drone had not been delivered yet.
  • In 2023, each armed force ordered two of these drones, costing around Rs 120 crore each.
  • This incident highlights India’s increasing use of Israeli drones for surveillance and reconnaissance.
“The vendor has retrieved the drone and will analyse what went wrong.”

This incident reflects the ongoing developments in India's defense capabilities, particularly in remotely-piloted aircraft systems.
newTitle: Israeli-Origin Military Drone Crashes into Sea Off Porbandar

title: UPSC cheating case: Puja Khedkar seeks pre-arrest bail, moves SC - Moneycontrol
Haryana BJP chief Mohan Lal Badoli, singer Rocky Mittal booked for gang-rape of Delhi resident in Himachal - The Indian Express
Ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar moves to Supreme Court after Delhi HC rejects anticipatory bail - Hindustan Times
summary:
Puja Khedkar Appeals to Supreme Court After Bail Rejection

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Puja Khedkar, a former IAS trainee, has moved to the Supreme Court after the Delhi High Court denied her anticipatory bail. She is accused of forging documents to gain eligibility for the 2022 UPSC exam.

  • Khedkar allegedly exploited benefits for OBC and disability categories.
  • The Delhi High Court described her actions as a "glaring example of fraud".
  • Public trust in competitive exams could be severely impacted if the allegations are substantiated.
  • Khedkar has been banned from UPSC and removed from IAS after her appointment was denied.
  • She claims to be targeted due to her accusations of sexual harassment against a senior official.
“The public's trust in competitive exams and their credibility would be severely damaged if such charges were proven true.” - Delhi High Court

This case raises significant concerns about meritocracy within public service and could have broader implications for the integrity of civil service examinations in India.
newTitle: Puja Khedkar Appeals to Supreme Court After Bail Rejection

title: Accused of ‘gangrape’, who are Haryana BJP chief Mohan Lal Badoli, ‘former Modi bhakt’ Rocky Mittal - The Indian Express

Smriti Irani, filmmaker Shekhar Kapur join PM Museum’s new power team; Nripendra Mishra gets 5-year extension - The Indian Express
summary:
Smriti Irani, filmmaker Shekhar Kapur join PM Museum’s new power team; Nripendra Mishra gets another term

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

The Prime Ministers’ Museum & Library has reconstituted its society with significant new members including Smriti Irani and Shekhar Kapur, while Nripendra Mishra continues as chairperson for another five years.

  • Nripendra Mishra reappointed as chairperson for another five-year term.
  • New members include Smriti Irani, Shekhar Kapur, and others from various sectors.
  • The society now has 34 members, expanded from 29.
“The central government hereby reconstitutes the society and the executive council of the Prime Ministers Museum & Library, New Delhi,”

This reconstitution comes amid discussions about the museum's significance and its societal role as a repository for India’s political history.
newTitle: Smriti Irani and Shekhar Kapur Join the New PM Museum Power Team

title: UPSC cheating case: Puja Khedkar seeks pre-arrest bail, moves Supreme Court - Deccan Herald
summary:
Puja Khedkar Seeks Pre-Arrest Bail in UPSC Cheating Case

Date: 14 January 2025

Source: Unknown

The appellant, Puja Khedkar, is accused of cheating and fraudulently claiming benefits under the OBC quota to pass the UPSC exams. She argues that the High Court ignored key facts in her case.

  • Khedkar was accused of presenting false information regarding her income and OBC status.
  • The High Court noted her conduct as part of a larger conspiracy and deemed further investigation necessary.
  • The UPSC filed an FIR on July 19, alleging fraudulent claims in her application.
  • The High Court highlighted luxury assets that contradict her claimed income.
  • UPSC canceled her provisional candidature on July 31, 2024.
  • A previous bail plea was dismissed on August 8, 2024.
“The present incident is a classic example of fraud committed not only with a constitutional body but the society at large and necessary interrogation is warranted...”

This case raises serious concerns about the integrity of the UPSC examination process and how fraud undermines public trust.
newTitle: Puja Khedkar Seeks Pre-Arrest Bail in UPSC Cheating Case

title: Justice Sujoy Paul to take over as Acting Chief Justice of Telangana High Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Justice Sujoy Paul to take over as Acting Chief Justice of Telangana High Court

Published on: 14 Jan 2025, 2:15 pm

The Central government has notified the appointment of Justice Sujoy Paul as the acting Chief Justice of the Telangana High Court, following the transfer of Justice Alok Aradhe to the Bombay High Court.

  • The appointment is made under Article 223 of the Constitution of India.
  • Justice Paul was previously a judge at the Madhya Pradesh High Court before his transfer.
  • He enrolled as an advocate in 1990 and has experience in various branches of law.
  • Justice Paul was elevated to High Court judge in 2011 and became a permanent judge in 2014.
"In exercise of the powers conferred by Article 223 of the Constitution of India, the President is pleased to appoint Shri Justice Sujoy Paul, Judge of the Telangana High Court, to perform the duties of the office of the Chief Justice of that High Court consequent upon transfer of Shri Justice Alok Aradhe, Chief Justice of Telangana High Court as Chief Justice of Bombay High Court."

This transition marks a significant change in the leadership of the Telangana High Court as Justice Paul steps into his new role.
newTitle: Justice Sujoy Paul Appointed Acting Chief Justice of Telangana High Court

title: After death of Kerala youth, India reiterates demand to release all Indians serving in Russian military - The Hindu
summary:
India Demands Release of Nationals Following Death in Russian Military

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: The Hindu

An Indian national recruited by the Russian military has been killed in the conflict with Ukraine, prompting India to urge Russia for the release of all Indian nationals involved with the military.

  • An Indian from Kerala has died while another has been injured in Russia's conflict with Ukraine.
  • The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) of India is actively engaging with Russian authorities regarding the situation.
  • Efforts are being made to facilitate the return of the deceased and the injured national to India.
  • The MEA has formally demanded the discharge of all Indian citizens in the Russian military.
“We have learnt of the unfortunate death of an Indian national from Kerala, who had apparently been recruited to serve in the Russian Army,” - MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal

This incident highlights significant concerns regarding Indian nationals enlisted in foreign militaries and India's diplomatic responses to such situations.
newTitle: India Demands Release of Nationals Following Death in Russian Military

title: State Health Agency suspends empanelment of Shifa hospital for 6 months - Greater Kashmir
summary:
State Health Agency Suspends Shifa Hospital for 6 Months

Date: January 14

Source: Kashmir News Observer

The State Health Agency (SHA) in Jammu and Kashmir has suspended the empanelment of Shifa hospital for violating National Health Authority (NHA) guidelines, imposing a penalty of over Rs 26 lakh for illegal payments collected from patients.

  • The suspension lasts for six months, effective immediately.
  • A penalty of Rs 2615000 has been imposed due to grievances against the hospital.
  • The SHA received numerous complaints regarding coercion of patients and denial of treatment.
  • Shifa hospital failed to respond to Show Cause Notices issued by the SHA.
  • Dialysis treatments will continue for existing patients under specific schemes.
“The hospital is flagrantly violating the guidelines of the scheme including coercing the patients to incur out of pocket expenditure, denial of treatment to the patients.”

This situation highlights the importance of compliance with health guidelines and the Agency's commitment to protecting patient rights.
newTitle: State Health Agency Suspends Shifa Hospital for 6 Months

title: How Kerala athlete’s courage laid bare cycle of sexual abuse involving neighbours, classmates - ThePrint
How Kerala athlete’s courage laid bare cycle of sexual abuse involving neighbours, classmates - ThePrint
Maha Kumbh: First 'Amrit Snan' held, over 3.5 crore devotees take holy dip in Sangam on Makar Sankranti - Deccan Herald
summary:
Over 3.5 Crore Devotees Participate in First 'Amrit Snan' at Maha Kumbh

Published: 14 January 2025, 13:32 IST

On the occasion of 'Makar Sankranti', over 3.5 crore devotees, including seers and saints from various Akharas, took a holy dip at the Sangam in Prayagraj for the first 'Amrit Snan' of the Mahakumbh festival.

  • More than 3.5 crore devotees participated in the ritual.
  • Uttar Pradesh police reported that over 1.6 crore devotees took the holy dip around noon.
  • The bathing ceremony commenced at dawn with different Akharas taking turns.
  • Seers displayed their weapons as part of the rituals.
  • Extensive security measures were implemented with over 60 thousand personnel deployed.
“The first 'Amrit Snan' went off well and there was no report of any untoward incident.” - UP principal secretary home Sanjay Prasad

This event marks a significant occasion in the Mahakumbh festival, emphasizing its cultural and religious importance.
newTitle: Over 3.5 Crore Devotees Participate in First 'Amrit Snan' at Maha Kumbh

title: India one of few countries in position to talk to Russia, Ukraine and Israel, Iran: Jaishankar - The Hindu
summary:
Jaishankar Highlights India's Unique Diplomatic Position Amid Global Conflicts

Published on: January 14, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar emphasized India’s strategic role in global diplomacy, stating that India is one of the few nations capable of engaging in discussions with both Russia and Ukraine, as well as Israel and Iran.

  • Jaishankar made these remarks during his visit to Spain while interacting with the Indian community.
  • He noted India’s capacity to contribute ideas to global issues amidst various ongoing conflicts.
  • India's Prime Minister, Narendra Modi, has visited both Russia and Ukraine to foster dialogue.
  • India is also uniquely positioned to mediate between Israel and Iran due to its involvement in international groups like the Quad and BRICS.
  • Jaishankar acknowledged India's infrastructural advancements in terms of railways, highways, and space technology, including the Chandrayaan-3 mission.
“There are very few countries today who are in a position to talk to Russia and to Ukraine,” Jaishankar stated.

Jaishankar concluded with remarks on the importance of maintaining connections between the Indian diaspora and their homeland, expressing appreciation for the contributions made by expatriates to India.
newTitle: Jaishankar Highlights India's Unique Diplomatic Position Amid Global Conflicts

title: India one of few countries in position to talk to Russia, Ukraine and Israel, Iran: EAM Jaishankar - The Hindu
Centre clears appointment of Justice Alok Aradhe as Bombay High Court Chief Justice - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Justice Alok Aradhe Appointed as Chief Justice of Bombay High Court

Published on: 14 Jan 2025, 1:27 pm

The Central government has approved the appointment of Justice Alok Aradhe as the Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court.

  • The President confirmed the transfer of Justice Aradhe in accordance with Article 222 of the Constitution.
  • Justice Aradhe previously served as the Chief Justice of the Telangana High Court.
  • He will succeed Chief Justice DK Upadhyaya, who is moving to the Delhi High Court.
  • Justice Aradhe's judicial career includes roles in the Madhya Pradesh High Court, Jammu and Kashmir High Court, and Karnataka High Court.
"In exercise of the power conferred by clause (1) of Article 222 of the Constitution of India, the President, after consultation with the Chief Justice of India, is pleased to transfer Shri Justice Alok Aradhe..."

Justice Aradhe is expected to assume his new responsibilities shortly.
newTitle: Justice Alok Aradhe Appointed as Chief Justice of Bombay High Court

title: Amritpal’s supporters float ‘Akali Dal Waris Punjab De’ party - The Tribune India
UGC NET December 2024 Revised Exam Schedule Released, Check New Date Sheet - News18
summary:
UGC NET December 2024 Exam Schedule Revised

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: News18

The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the revised schedule for the UGC-National Eligibility Test (UGC-NET) December 2024. The exams initially set for January 15 will now take place on January 21 and 27, 2025.

Key Points:

  • The UGC-NET 2024 exams will be held for 85 subjects.
  • Exams will now occur on January 21 and 27, 2025.
  • The first shift is from 9:30 am to 12:30 pm and the second from 3 pm to 6 pm.
  • The exam consists of two papers: Paper 1 (50 questions) and Paper 2 (100 questions).
“In the interest of aspirants, the National Testing Agency (NTA) has decided to postpone the UGC-NET December 2024 Exam scheduled on 15th January 2025 only. The New date of exam will announce later,” stated the official notice.

Candidates must meet minimum score requirements: 40% for unreserved and 35% for reserved categories.

This exam is significant for candidates pursuing Assistant Professor and Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) positions in Indian universities and colleges.
newTitle: UGC NET December 2024 Exam Schedule Revised

title: Blow to NCP(SP), Sena (UBT) bids to warm up to Mahayuti as Amit Shah targets Sharad Pawar, Uddhav Thackeray - The Indian Express
summary:
Amit Shah Critiques Shiv Sena (UBT) and NCP (SP) Amid Political Realignments

Publication Date: Recently
Source: Indian Express

Union Home Minister Amit Shah has targeted Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena (UBT) and the Sharad Pawar-led NCP (SP) during a BJP state executive meeting, asserting that the Eknath Shinde-headed Shiv Sena and the Ajit Pawar-led NCP are the genuine representatives of their parties.

  • Shah emphasized that the BJP aims to unseat the Shiv Sena (UBT) from the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC).
  • Shah criticized the political history of betrayal associated with Pawar and Thackeray.
  • Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis stressed the importance of hard work ahead of the upcoming local body polls.
  • Reactions from NCP(SP) and Shiv Sena (UBT) members highlighted a trend in attacks against Sharad Pawar.
  • Recent political shifts in Maharashtra have raised speculation about potential new alliances.
“The resounding mandate in the BJP’s favour has put an end to the politics of betrayal which Sharad Pawar started in 1978.” - Amit Shah

This political landscape suggests continued tensions and realignments within Maharashtra's political parties as the BJP prepares for local elections.
newTitle: Amit Shah Critiques Shiv Sena (UBT) and NCP (SP) Amid Political Realignments

title: PM Modi-Omar Abdullah bonhomie to an absent NC MP: 5 takeaways from Z-Morh tunnel inauguration in Sonamarg - The Indian Express
summary:
PM Modi-Omar Abdullah bonhomie to an absent NC MP: 5 takeaways from Z-Morh tunnel inauguration in Sonamarg

Publication Date: Recently

Source: The Indian Express

The inauguration of the Sonamarg tunnel was characterized by a warm interaction between Prime Minister Modi and Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, who praised Modi's promises and highlighted the infrastructural projects bringing change to Jammu and Kashmir.

  • Abdullah noted increased trust in PM Modi among the people of Jammu and Kashmir.
  • The CM highlighted Modi's past commitments and recent infrastructure projects as crucial for connectivity.
  • Modi praised Abdullah's personal achievements, including his participation in a marathon.
  • Union Minister Nitin Gadkari emphasized the Modi government's push for critical infrastructure in J&K.
  • The absence of Aga Ruhullah Mehdi, the MP from Srinagar, raised eyebrows at the event.
“This is Modi… If he makes promises, he fulfils them too. Everything has a time, the right things will happen at the right time.” – PM Modi

This event underscores the ongoing political dynamics in Jammu and Kashmir, amidst visible bipartisanship in addressing infrastructure needs.
newTitle: PM Modi and Omar Abdullah Highlight Sonamarg Tunnel Inauguration
